title: Special Awards Presentations

author: Anthony G. Cohn, School of Computing, University of Leeds
introducer: Manuela M. Veloso, Computer Science Department, Carnegie Mellon University

segmentation: Good morning.
I'm Eric orbits the I've been serving as the immediate past President of AAAI, and in that role I've been cheering the awards committee and the Fellows Committee.
Let me start with our fellows each year.
That Ripley, I recognize, is a very small with individuals who have made significant sustained contributions to the field of AI units, Fellows program and fellows are recognized as having.
Unusual distinction in the science and profession and the recognized fellows for technical contributions or performing unique extended service to the ad community.
Among other considerations.
It's very interesting.
Panel and reflections are quite interesting to hear about the nominations each year.
This year, fellows are Murray Campbell.
Boi Faltings Yolanda Gil, Peter Patel Schneider, Francesco Rossi, and Peter Stone and.
If the fellas are here in the audience, they just stand up will be celebrating them tonight as well.
At the fellows reception.
So let's hear it for the fellows each year to see you all here.
Congratulations.
Yeah.
Two years ago we started a new program called the Senior Members Program at AAAI.
The senior Member of Status recognizes Triplea.
Members have achieved significant accomplishments within the field of AI.
To be eligible for nomination for senior member, candidates must have been active in the professional arena for at least 10 years.
We consider the committee considers the Candidate scholarship, leadership, and professional service.
The senior members sharing invite.
Two of the senior members who are here today up to receive certificates are Adele, how Edward Katz, Kevin Knight and Barry O'Sullivan.
We all know them over the years for doing great work, so I think Edward Cats are you here.
Come on up.
And Barry O'Sullivan is here today as well.
Wait?

The Classic Paper Award is given out to recognize a paper this year from the 1993 AAAI proceedings, which, as you may recall, people in the audience here was in Washington DC was remember that being a very hot summer conference.
We have one winning paper this year as the Classic Paper Award and two honorable mentions the 1st paper.

For that proceedings learning interface agents by by Pattie Maes and Robin Kozarac and this paper was was cited for highlighting directions and opportunities with harnessing machine learning and inference in automated personal assistance and human computer interactions.
Oppresion piece of work that Harold did quite a bit of work in this in this space and several conferences.
I think Henry Lieberman is here to accept the award for Patty and Robin.
Man up.
That worked out.
Lot of documents up here on this counter.
Honorable mention for that year.

1993 conference goes to our consistency in our consistency again by Christian Becae, Marie Odile put gate for contributions to the foundations of constraint programming, providing an influential optimal propagation algorithm, and these coauthors could not be here today.
Finally, I will mention goes to a paper that really explored the idea of building automated reasoning systems from large scale corpora.
Again very prescient given what we do today with the explosion of the web and web content.
This paper is automatically constructing a dictionary for information extraction tasks.
Ellen Rylov an I believe we have one of Ellen students here today to accept the award.
This is Louis Hanwang mine up.
My temper.
Alan not make it today.
And now we move to a Distinguished Service Award, and I'll invite.
Also introduce our new President of Triple AI, Manuela Belloso.
Thank you very much.
Thanks all for coming and just a special welcome and I just want to introduce his award as in fact.
Oops, sorry.
To Anthony Con I mean Tony Khan is like has been present present among us for a long time and it's my deepest pleasure.
Really big pressure to give him these award for all his contributions and the sustained contributions in professional societies, triple AI.
Each Chi Aiji press conferences, journals and funding agencies around the world Tony.
Oh here.
I just wanted to say few words.
I haven't got this award.
I'm very honored to have got this Ward.
I want to thank Shipley.
I very much for selecting me.
It's sometimes said this is the Ward you get if you never learn to say no.
I'm being being advised as a grad student to practice saying no every morning.
I guess I just didn't practice enough, but I think it's very important.
Does say yes, our community depends on voluntary service in many aspects, from viewing to organizing conferences to running societies.
It also say I've had a lot of fun being involved in so many organizations and working with so many great people over the years.
I've made a lot of friends in this way, again, both personally and professionally for my service work.
I've worked with 70 people.
It's invidious to pick out any particular collaborators over there without to pick out anybody.
It would be probably be GAIL got love who's my Co chair with me in 2003, HK and Raparo, who I worked with.
Senator Chief Credit and Chief of the AIJ before years, right, particularly thanks to both Georg and Ray were working that making that work so much fun.
And now I'm enjoying working with senior Director who's taking race place and also particularly like to thank all the other HI trustees kicking some here.
That form I worked with over the years.

Finally, I want to say this in the world, which is probably deserved at least as much by the significant other of you or D. Certainly my wife has had to put up with me being away at many many committee meetings late night.
Skype calls because of timing issues.
So once you complained, often had to pick up things at home.
In my absence, it's amazing how often the domestic disasters, such as washing machine, flooded kitchen, see that happened when I'm away.
So I want to record my sincere thanks to my wife, GL.
I'm happy to say she's figured out how to spend your money already.
So thanks again to AAA.
I would have worked.
